I quickly started searching through my connections to my spiders. Most of them were weak, and getting weaker. I quickly chose one that was dying and teleported to it. And the scene there was horrifying. Not that being stuck in a web after I teleported helped, but. There were almost two hundred spiders resting on the webs, half of them were slowly dying, and the other half were dead. They were ripped open, with puncture marks in their abdomens. And those wounds were overflowing with eggs. There were thousands of them, tens of thousands. It was a gruesome sight. My poor cultists… They slaughtered each other. After mating too! What kind of life is that!?!?! Mating once and then being killed to… I’m guessing feed the young. I am so glad I did not become a spider. That would have sucked.

Wait, the spiders, how are they doing!?!? I felt my connections to my spiders, and… Why were there more..? I felt my connections, and the weakest of them had been snuffed out, killed by whatever process happened during their mating cycle. But there were new, faint connections. And there were a lot of them. Thousands of them… THE EGGS!

The eggs… hahaha. HAHAHAHA. MWAHAHAHAHAHA! The cultists' babies were automatically initiated. Oh thank you oh Great Mosquito God, perhaps you don’t want to give my soul away quite yet. I knew you loved me!

Head Cultist of The Mosquito God level up. All stats +2.

Skill Born into It obtained.

Oooo! I got a new skill! System! What’s Born into It do?

Born into It:
Makes children born of members of the cult much less likely to attempt a revolt. All boosts granted by skills from Head Cultist of The Mosquito God are 12562% (Number of cult members) more effective on members who were born into the cult and have never left.

That… is absolutely useless! I DON’T HAVE ANY SKILLS THAT BOOST MY MEMBERS! Wait! Yes I do! I just never used it! I have Lead Prayers! Yeah! I bet Mosquito God would like that! Okay, I got this. Even if it’s currently not useful to help in defense, it is still useful nonetheless. I bet Mosquito God is gonna help us once he’s been born. So I can’t wait to try this out!

comments.comment_text: Thanks for the chapter keep up the good work!

chapters.name: 35. Web
chapters.content:
Alright, first thing first. I need out of this web. I flapped my wings a little, freeing myself from the web and leaving a small hole behind in the process. Huh, I should work on that. I don’t want to make the web unstable… Whatever, the spiders can figure it out. Webs are their domain, not mine. Now then, how to protect all of these eggs… Wait, do I need to? They are surrounded by what I assume is kilometers of webs, I mean, I don’t think anything is getting in here anytime soon. And if there was really a problem I don’t think they would have all killed themselves so quickly. They probably would have left a few behind to defend their eggs. Yeah, I’ll trust my cultists knew what they were doing… Yeah no.

They didn’t even have the brain power to realize they could hunt. I totally need to protect these stupid eggs. But… I can’t even fly around in here! There’s absolutely no way I could do anything to help. GAH! There are no good solutions to my problems! Ever! You know what, I’ll just trust them to Mosquito God. I really can’t think of anything else. Alright, so, I guess I should try and lead a prayer… Wait, I’m having a bunch of eggs pray, will that even do anything? Eh, whatever. At least it will work for me.

So! Eggs, lone spider and possibly others that I haven’t seen yet. Let’s all close our eyes and pray for salvation. Oh great and powerful Mosquito God, please protect all of us here, any somehow living cultist and all of these defenseless eggs. Thanks for listening, Mosquito God, amen.

After the prayer, something changed. Suddenly, the wind started picking up and storms clouds rolled in from out of nowhere. All around me the web was shaking from the wind, and possibly an earthquake, it’s a lot harder to tell from the air. There was a crack of lighting and a tree was charred black in an instant. No fire appeared from the strike, all that could be seen was a charred tree. Then, a red mist emanated from the tree. Slowly turning everything it touched to the color of blood. It spread out, slowly at first, but picking up speed the longer it was alive. In an instant, it surrounded me, the eggs, and everything I could see.

The tale has been stolen; if detected on Amazon, report the violation.

Then, as quickly as it began, everything stopped. The storms rolled away, the wind died back down, and all of the shaking ended. I flew there, dazed. What the hell did the Mosquito God just do? Looking around, all the webs changed from their looking like normal webs. They were a nice white, like webs, before. But now, they were blood red with hints of black, and they were flowing. The individual lines themselves seemed to be just as stationary as before, but something was different, and not just the color. I looked closer, trying to figure out what it was…

Uh oh, wait a second. I flew up to one of the strands, and it wasn’t sticky anymore. I didn’t get stuck. But that wasn’t the worst part, I landed on the web, and it rippled. Like a liquid. My presence sent a small ripple throughout the whole of the web, pinpointing my location for all who could see. Because the strands were turned to blood.

The Mosquito God turned the web into blood!

Mosquito God 1% to birth.

What the hell!?!?! Seriously!?!?! HOW IS THAT EVEN POSSIBLE!?!?! Besides the plain fact that he just figured out a way to transmute what I think is basically silk into blood, how the hell does it stay up!?!?! BLOOD DOESN’T FLOAT! Actually though, it doesn’t form shields around you either. Hmmmmm. Fuck! Magic makes no sense. A bloody web. I don’t think I can get behind that. At all. I’m just gonna go to sleep. Goodnight, Mosquito God, I hope you enjoy this new web of yours. Because I am not dealing with it right now. Way too much work. Way. Too. Much. Hopefully it will at least protect the eggs while I’m asleep. That was what we asked for.

comments.comment_text: Thanks for the chapter keep up the good work!

chapters.name: 36. EGGS!
chapters.content:
I woke up to a harrowing realization. I DIDN’T CHECK ON THE EGGS! What the hell is wrong with me!?!?! How did I forget them! I literally prayed for them! I was just too exhausted because of the praying, yeah, I bet Mosquito God took my power or something, and it exhausted me. I didn’t have a chance to. And it was not even slightly my fault! It was all Mosquito God! Wait, no assigning blame can wait, I need to check on the eggs! I looked where I left the eggs last night, and they were gone. GONE! Where do thousands of eggs and hundreds of spider bodies disappear off to!?!?! It’s not that easy! I searched around frantically, but to no avail, there were no signs of any eggs within a hundred meters of their original resting place. WAIT! I CAN TELEPORT TO THEM! Alright, quickly. I searched my links, surprised the first one wasn’t an egg, or the second, or the third… Wait a second. Did they… hatch!?!?! THEY WERE JUST LAYED! Alright, scorpion spiders are slightly scarier than I thought. But where did they go? I picked one at random, and teleported to it.

…I got teleported like a meter to the right… WHERE ARE THEY HIDING!?!?! SPIDERS! COME OUT HERE!

At my command, the spiders unmerged from the webs. Not emerged, unmerged. All around me, bright red spiders’ bodies formed out of the web. They were like water elementals slowly being formed by a lousy golemancer. When they were done, I was surrounded by thousands of spiders.

Was that because of Mosquito God or me…? I know I may have caused a problem with the mosquitoes’ births… I’m gonna assume no. It couldn’t have been me. Yup. Whatever impacted the webs must’ve done the same thing to the spider! The spider egg sacs are basically the same thing as the web, and Mosquito God is for mosquitoes, not spiders. You can’t blame him, it was an honest mistake. But kinda a cool one. I wish I could merge with blood… That is awesome.

This story has been unlawfully obtained without the author's consent. Report any appearances on Amazon.

Alright, I guess you guys can go back to doing whatever you were doing. At that, the spiders remerged with the web, doing who knows what in there. I wonder… If I used Protection of Blood, what would it do to the spiders…? And would the web collapse…? You know what, I think I’ll wait until I’m clear of the web to use that skill now. Yeah, it seems like a bad idea…

Alright, what can I do now? I think these spiders can protect themselves by now. They are literally everywhere. Alright, before I leave though, I need to do something. Are any of you spiders at that flytrap field? Oh cool. I teleported to the one who said yes. At the flytrap, I found the spider that was there last time. Cool. Alright, can any other spiders get here too?

This time, the spiders  arrived in an instant. They all just sprung up in an instance. Cool. Maybe being part of a blood web has its advantages too. Alright spiders! It is time!

Now, I know you were all born today, or possibly yesterday, but it is time for war. Those venus flytraps are evil creatures. They have decimated your fellow cultists, and they need to be destroyed for the good of Mosquito God, so, ATTACK!

At that, my spiders stood there, on their webs. Doing nothing. God dammit. Alright spiders, do you have any way to attack? At that question, my new spiders sent me a rather harrowing image. These spiders, they weren’t scorpion spiders. They were… MOSQUITO SPIDERS! The spiders used some weird blood magic to squeeze a boar dry of blood. It turned into a wrinkly corpse in an instant. The blood in the boar flew out from its eyes, the wrinkling starting there, it spread along the rest of its body. By the time it was done, all of the meat somehow got removed too, leaving a really weird sight. There was nothing left but a loose skin suit around its bones.

Alright… can you do that to the flytraps? I think they drink blood from the ground. Alright spiders, go drain the blood from those venus flytraps! Make them regret ever eating a mosquito!

comments.comment_text: Mosquito god? More like blood god

chapters.name: 37. Flytrap Genocide
chapters.content:
Now, I’d like to say that the spiders rushed out in a wave from the web, and massacred the venus flytraps. Because that would have been awesome. Commanding a wave of blood spiders to do as I command, an army. But, instead they decided to be creepy, as my cute spiders tend to do.

The spiders started by fusing themselves back into the web. In an instant, they had disappeared again; I think they’re getting better at that. And then their own form of war started. It was slow at first, not very noticeable, but as time progressed it became clear. The venus flytraps were slowly withering, their red mouths losing color. They acted like leaves being heated near a fire, slowly curling in on themselves as they lost the blood sustaining them. Before long, all that remained of those dastardly flytraps were there dried out husks. With no evidence of what happened, other than the vibrant web nearby.

Ha. Hahaha. HAHAHAHAHA! YOU’VE BEEN AVENGED, MOSQUITO FRIEND! BUT DO NOT WORRY! FOR THIS IS NOT THE END! I will not stop until venus flytraps have been removed from this world, for our kinds cannot coexist!

Now, where the hell did that blood go? I didn’t see it exit from anything like that boar. Spiders? I turned back to my spiders, to see a new sight. The web was flowing, like the rapids of a river. Starting from the ground, all the strands of the web looked to be rushing inwards, towards the center. Before I knew what happened, the web was gone. In its place was a wall of blood, rising like a tsunami as it picked up more strands of webs, becoming a natural disaster. After fifty meters, it was uprooting the trees as it went through, and after two hundred it was leaving deep pits in the ground where it passed.

The forest was quickly being consumed, and I may or may not have caused it. Uh… What the hell!?!?! I just had them eat some flytraps! What happened!?!?!?! As I watched the devastation caused by my spiders feeding, I felt a little bad for my ex-cultist. Because even if he did survive the forest turning to webs, I didn’t think he’d get through this. That was literally a natural disaster at this point, and… Wait, disaster? No, no, stop thinking about it. Definitely not. This was not me. This was Mosquito God, yup. He made evil spiders, not me. My disaster magnet had no bearing on this current predicament. So, I should probably see if this stops eventually.

Did you know this text is from a different site? Read the official version to support the creator.

By now, the blood was fading from view, even with its enormous height, I was starting to lose sight of it as it disappeared into the distance. I started flying after it, but it just kept getting farther away until all I could see was a layer of rock with pieces of roots piercing through it. As it progressed, the blood had dug deeper and deeper until it hit solid rock just a few meters below what used to be ground level.

Yeah, this forest is never coming back. It was quite literally uprooted. That’s too bad, I liked the weird forest biome, it was starting to feel like home…

I stopped chasing the wave, as I was obviously never going to catch, and flew in place for a bit. Thinking about what to do next. Sadly, that question got answered for me. An ear piercing roar emanated out from the direction that the blood had flown in, and I could see something starting to rise from the spot, even though it must have been many kilometers away.

It started as a red blob, as big as a mountain, it was only barely half the height of one, but it spread itself out over the area of at least eight. Slowly, the blob started shaping itself into something coherent. It started by taking huge blobs of itself, eight of them and spreading them out four on two different sides of itself. Then, it took its center mass and started to form two ovular pieces, connected at the center. Finally, great fangs grew from its front, as the blobs of blood elongated into eight legs. It was a giant blood spider. Fuck.

chapters.name: 38. Giant Monsters
chapters.content:
So… A giant blood spider made out of a forest’s worth of blood. And thousands of other blood spiders. Wait, more than a forest’s worth of blood! Normally a forest’s worth of blood would just be the animals in it, but half these plants use blood instead of water. So, many forest’s worth of blood… Alright. I guess I should get over there. I perused my mental connections to the spiders, finding most of them were now almost exactly the same. Weird, must be some kind of hive mind. I teleported to one of them at random, as it didn’t seem like it really made a difference.

The teleportation sent me well above the clouds, right next to the spider's head. Oddly enough, it was much harder to tell how truly massive this spider was. All I could see was a wall of red that seemed to go on forever. Looking down, I could see the true devastation the birth of this sider caused. It looked like god decided to just scoop a circle out of the ground, leaving behind nothing but the rock underneath.

There were different places around the edge of the disaster that I could finally see without anything to block my sight. On one side, there was the barren waste land I came from, which was somehow more inviting than the one I was above. On another, I could see the field of evil grass that tried to devour me whole. There were different biomes all around too, bigger, more massive forests with what looked like jungle trees, a volcanic region, where the ground was darker than the rock I now knew was beneath it, and even an arctic area, where there was nothing but white for ages.

This world is so strange, yet so oddly beautiful sometimes. I couldn’t help but admire the view, and wonder what else this giant spider was blocking me from seeing.

Trait Apocalypse Maker unlocked.

The story has been taken without consent; if you see it on Amazon, report the incident.

…Alright. Whatever. I’ll deal with that later. Suddenly, the giant wall of red started to move, and it was quick. I know how you usually imagine giant monsters, as slow and easy to trip, but this thing was anything but. It moved faster than a train, and it did not want to stop. It was so huge it caused wind currents around it, sweeping me up and sending me barrelling with it as it ran.

I managed to stabilize myself, barely and get a look at where we were going. The spider was rushing towards the plot of evil grass, and it was not slowing down. What the hell? There is literally nothing but space wielding acid grass over there, and it is not fun. But, not being one to question my new apocalypse engine, I just let it keep going. It seemed really determined right then, and I was not one to get in the way of something that could probably squish a skyscraper like a bug, let alone a measly bug.

As it neared the field, the grass started to react. It started growing uncontrollably, getting taller and taller until it also reached the mountainous height the spider was. The grass was much more intimidating like this, scarily so. And then, just like the spider had, it started to take a shape. The grass ripped itself from the ground, pulling dirt out as it went. Unlike the spider, the grass started shaping itself at the base. The grass came together to form a few giant stems, weaved together like someone would weave a basket, except it was pulled so tight it was impossible to tell it was made up of different pieces. Then, it moved on to making some leaves. Each leaf came as a pair, connected at their edge. The leaves were made with long, thin appendages on the edges, hundreds of them each. Wait a second… This looks familiar. Hmmm. I tried to think about where I had seen something like this, and soon it became clear. As I saw the leaves snap shut on themselves, I was filled with rage. That dirty grass. I can’t believe it! These plants have been in the way for as long as I can remember! IT WAS A GIANT VENUS FLYTRAP ALL ALONG!

chapters.name: 39. Kaiju Battle!
chapters.content:
The two giant monsters stared each other down from their massive heights, which I guess I was also at. The venus flytrap had ended up growing to be ten times taller than the already massive spider, and it did not look happy. The tension in the air was palpable, or maybe that was moisture from all the blood that's got to be coming off that spider. But either way, it was clear to all what was about to happen. A KAIJU BATTLE!

I mean, this situation is extremely dangerous and will probably even further change the landscape from what the making of the spider did, but how can you not be excited!?!?! WHO DOESN’T WANT TO SEE A REAL LIFE KAIJU BATTLE!?!?!?! ESPECIALLY IF I OWN ONE! Wait, does that mean… KAIJUMON BATTLE!?!?! Yes! This should be a national sport! Wait, maybe it is! I hope it is somewhere. If there are no nations where kaiju battle is a sport, this world deserves the disasters that come with me being around.

Suddenly, while I was mulling over how to make sure Kaiju Battles became a national sport, the flytrap attacked. Its stem extended over the distance between the kaijus, and one of its… mouths? Snapped shut on my spider's head. There were huge clouds of red steam coming off of it, and my spider screeched at this. Its inhuman cry piercing the air and spreading for miles. My spider’s, I’m gonna call it Mosquito God’s Baby from now on, head or what was left of it, merged back into its body then reappeared below the Venus Flytrap from Hell’s head. Its fangs closed around the stem, and Mosquito God’s Baby screeched in pain as it severed one of the Hell creature’s heads. At this, the venus flytrap repeats its first attack, aiming for the new head. Except, when it gets close, two giant portals appear in the air. They looked like black rips in the sky. No light that entered could escape, as if they were blackholes that pulled in nothing but the light. The flytrap stuck its mouth through one portal, and out the other. Its mouth came around two of the spider's legs, and snapped. It completely severed them, a lake’s worth of blood falling from the sky. Mosquito God’s Baby couldn’t stay standing at this, and fell to the ground onto its back. Its remaining six legs swinging in the air as it tried to right itself. The flytrap came in for the finishing blow, trying to bite Mosquito God’s Baby in half. But as it closed its mouth, Mosquito God’s Baby split in half. I regrew its legs and a head on each half, and there were two. There were two Mosquito God’s Babies. That is awesome. I love my Kaijumon. It is the best Kaijumon. It's as invincible as me! The flytrap, clearly seeing its inevitable divide, brought its mouth back to its body and made a defense. A wall of interwoven roots burst from the ground, growing taller and taller, until it reached the plant’s height. The roots then expanded into a dome, covering the whole of the plant until nothing but black, interwoven roots could be seen.

If you stumble upon this narrative on Amazon, be aware that it has been stolen from Royal Road. Please report it.

At this, Mosquito God’s Babies decided to start climbing the roots. They went in a single file line, presumably testing it before the second one came. As the first one started climbing on the roots, it was absorbed. The roots stuck out wherever the spider touched, and sucked the blood out of it. In just a few moments, the spider had been completely absorbed, no longer in sight. Seeing this, Mosquito God’s other baby decided to JOIN ITS BROTHER! WHAT THE HELL JUST HAPPENED!?!? WHY DID YOU DO THAT!?!?!

At my question, the entire dome started shaking. It was light at first, barely noticeable, but it slowly got stronger until it was unmistakable. It started shaking so hard it was causing earthquakes for kilometers around. And then it imploded. Blood and black roots collapsed in on themselves, causing a howling wind as air tried to escape from the giant dome of death trying to kill it. And then everything stopped. All that was left of that massive battle was a huge ball of red and black, the size of a mountain, just sitting in a wasteland.

chapters.name: 40. Evolution
chapters.content:
Well, that was something.

Assisted Kaiju of Ohio(Lv 50) kill + 2000 exp.

Level up!

+5 stat points

Level up!

…What? First of all, who the hell is Ohio? I assume it’s another god, considering their naming sense so far… But what? I assisted!?!?! And who the hell names their kaiju Kaiju, that feels wrong. That’s like leaving your starters the name of their species, only monsters like speedrunners do that! What are you, Ohio, the God of Speedrunners!?!?! I swear, no creativity. Also, again, how did I assist!?!?!

I can take away the levels if you want - Elly, Goddess of Chaos

No. no thank you, Elly. I’m good. I’ll stop complaining. Wow, what an assist that was, I helped so much, I should’ve probably gotten the bulk and them the assist, so unfair. Hahahaha. Alright, so, first things first. System, I want to level up!

Processing Request…

Heheheh, now… System, how much health do I have?
Health: 4220/4220

…I wonder if you’ll answer me a question, Elly. How much health does a normal person have?

Sure, they have like 1000.

Hahahaha… HAHAHAHAHAH! I HAVE MORE HEALTH THAN A PERSON! FINALLY! I HAVE FINALLY DONE IT! Wait, will I still be so high without my constitution buff though…? Let’s not think about it, actually. Yeah, that seems like a bad idea. I’m harder to kill than a regular person, and that’s all that matters! Now then, System, let me see those juicy evolution options!

Alright, I’ve still got all those options I had last time and what, one new one?

I don’t think Elly will be kind enough to give me another special evolution… There really is only one option, something I need to pick now so I can become OP in the future. The Poison Mosquito. chapters.name: Interlude: The Holy Quest
chapters.content:
Interlude: The Holy Quest

I was heading to the guild when I got the notification. My party was going to be upset, but they’d understand, and it really didn’t matter if they didn’t. This was bigger than them, and it was bigger than me. It was bigger than any mortal on this plane. It was a holy quest.

Job Elly’s Eyes Provides a new quest!!!

Watch the Interesting

Success:

Find and watch the reincarnator known as Mosquito Overlord, Mosquito of Death, or maybe just Tim until Elly decides he is not a problem.

Failure:

Lose track of Tim before Elly considers your job done, or fail to find him within 20 days.

Penalty for failure:

Unauthorized tale usage: if you spot this story on Amazon, report the violation.

Revoke the job Elly's Eyes and death.

Accept Quest(Y/N)

The Goddess of Chaos had called upon me, and it was time for me to deliver. Elly had given me my job, and it had gotten me through more situations than I could count. I could never reject her quest, if I refused I did not deserve to live, debts must be repaid. I got to the guild and left a letter with a receptionist. My party would get it when they dropped by later for our meeting; I had something more important to do.

I went to the church, as they should have more information for me than what was given in the quest. The church was on the other side of town, but it wasn’t a very long walk. It only took thirty minutes to reach, and it was clear something was happening. The priests were rushing about, bringing mana gems of various sizes from storage into the inner sanctum. As I walked up to the entrance, a nun noticed my presence, and I saw her run inside, clearly looking for someone.

I went into church, and saw what had happened. Elly’s statue had changed. Before, Elly’s statue was of a beautiful young woman, with blue crystals for eyes and a lovely toga that trailed down to the floor behind her. It was made of black quartz, carved by some of the best crafters in the kingdom. But it had changed, Elly’s statue had turned white, and her eyes were glowing red. She was angry, and that was never a good sign, for the priests, the kingdom, the world, and especially the one that caused it. There was going to be a disaster, and now was the time to prepare.

comments.comment_text:
I hope Tim can one day one up Elly without the threat of death!

P.s. First!

chapters.name: 41. The Pains of Evolving
chapters.content:
Just like last time, I felt my soul leave my body, probably my soul. Is my sense of self what my soul is? That’s too deep for me. I’m not gonna think about it. Well, my probably soul left my body, brought on a journey through the darkness. I was brought back to the battlefield I was at before, but it had changed. No longer were there insects eating or breaking eggs, the mosquitoes were defending them. The disaster mosquitoes were fighting back valiantly, but it was clear they would not last forever. They were slowly being killed off, as their enemies were numerous. There were millions of insects coming at them as quickly as they could. The mosquitoes were getting most of them, but as with all insect wars, numbers can beat all. Every now and then, some insect would get a lucky shot and kill one of the mosquitoes. Since the last time I saw them, their numbers had dwindled down to a mere few hundred, and they did not look like they would last long. Out of pure instinct, I did the same thing as last and used my piercing flight. It hatched thousands of eggs just like last time, but I could feel it. It would not be enough. This was nothing but a temporary solution, and it would lead to problems in the future. At this rate, their numbers would dwindle until all hope was lost, they needed to fight back instead. I flew there for a bit, before an idea came to me. To the insects, I radiated the idea that I wanted to talk to their manager. At that, they all turned around and scuttled away though the void, they’d be back, but this would help stave them off for even longer.

All of sudden, just like last time, I was back to my body, lying on the ground where I had started, though this time I appeared to have guards around me. The spiders appeared to have survived their assault on the flytraps, and a new web had been set up in the crater around me.

Mosquito God 1.5% to birth.

Please choose level 10 specialization for Fly.

Compensating…

Due to being 100% compatible with body, Bloodsucker+2 has been upgraded.

chapters.name: 42. Truly a Flying Master
chapters.content:
I want my rewards back, you stupid system! I am entitled to it! My brief having of Plant Communication was definitely very important to me! Can’t I at least be compensated for losing it? Pretty please…?

Processing Request…

Hmmm…. Maybe the gods will love me enough to give me that. We’ll see. So, where was I…? Oh yeah let’s check my new goodies! System, what does Aged Poison and Poisonous bite do?

Aged Poison:
The user can create a poison whose grade is based off of the age of the user. It slowly ferments in their body like a finely aged wine. Grade starts at Minor and increases by 1 for every 10 days the user was alive.

Current Grade: Minor

Poisonous Bite:

When the user bites a creature, they can inject the poisons in their body into it.

…What? Wait a second… I didn’t need to have this now!?!??! I COULD HAVE WAITED AND THE REWARDS WOULD HAVE BEEN THE SAME! I feel like I have been tricked. How does an aged poison be aged before I even have it…? I feel like this description definitely lied to me… Whatever, I’ll think about the implications of this later. Did I have anything else? Oh yeah, I got a new specialization for fly! I am getting so good at leveling that up! It’s like it’s the skill I use the most…

System! Let me see my options!

Fly(Lv5):

Thrusters:

Requirements - Fly(Lv5)

Increases the amount of thrust generated by wings.

Acrobatics:

Requirements - Fly(Lv5), Attempt to do mid-air tricks

Provides knowledge of basic mid-air tricks when Fly levels up.

Slicers:

Requirements - Fly(Lv5), Have wings with thin edges

A case of literary theft: this tale is not rightfully on Amazon; if you see it, report the violation.

Provides knowledge on how to slice objects with the edge of wings when Fly levels up.

Current Sensors:
Requirements -  Fly(Lv5), Survive an ambush by a flying predator

Can sense the currents caused by flying objects within fifteen feet of wings.

Flying Combatant:

Requirements -  Fly(Lv5), Aerial Combat Skill, Beat an opponent in aerial combat

Increases the ability to precisely maneuver in air. Aerial Combat provides more knowledge when leveled up(Does not Apply Retroactively).

Fly(Lv10):

Holier Flight:

Requirements- Fly(Lv10), A Holy Job, Holy Flight specialization

When flying, a blurry form of the user’s God can be seen flying above them. Increases the effectiveness of Holy Flight specialization by 10x(multiplicative).

…I only got one level 10 option. Was I that uneventful? Well, I mean, I might as well pick it. It’s probably better than picking another level 5 one. I bet it gets better as I travel anyways. Whatever, give me Holier Flight, System! I’m no loser, picking a level 5 specialization when I’m level 10. Hmph.

Now then, do I have anything else I should do? I could check my other traits, but… I don’t really want to read those right now. (It’s not that the author doesn’t want to write descriptions, not at all.) Alright! So, I’ve checked my important things, I guess I could go, leaving the spiders now. I don’t think there’s anything around here that could kill them. Sheesh, Mosquito God created some true monsters.

Alright, where to go…? Alright, my options are, edge of crater, edge of crater, edge of crater or… edge of crater. Goddammit. They ruined the environment! How am I going to figure out where to go? I guess I’ll just go towards the sun…

And so, I set off on another journey! Off into the unknown! …I didn’t make it out of the crater before I needed to go to bed. And so, I set off on a… a journey. I STILL DIDN’T MAKE IT TO THE EDGE! How wide is this crater?!?!?! This time when I woke up though, I got a really… nice? Surprise.

Trait Elder unlocked.

Elder:

When learning new skills, it is 50% harder, but improving skills you already have is 100% easier.

Be older than the expected lifespan of your base species (Mosquito(Tier 0)).

So, is that a good thing? I mean, yay I can level up my skills, but is it really worth being so hard to learn new skills? Ugh, I hate this. Why can’t it give me something with nothing but benefits? This stupid system, making me think! I DO NOT WANT TO THINK RIGHT NOW!

chapters.name: 43. Lava
chapters.content:
Alright, I’ll just take it as a benefit for now. It's no use thinking on it for this long. More importantly, I think I'm almost at the end of this stupid crater. I can't believe I(Mosquito God I mean) made such a monster. That's terrifying. As I started to reach the edge of the crater, I noticed something. The wall was… shimmering? And shaking? Uh oh. As I got closer, the shaking continued to get worse and worse, and I noticed something orange peaking above and dripping over the edge. Yeah, that’s always a good sign. Maybe I shouldn't… Eh, whatever. Let’s go! I’m invincible… wait no I’m not… I evolved. Uhhhhh.

At that thought, the wall collapsed down into the crater. A wave of orange collapsed into the crater, moving… oddly slow. After it passed the steep edge, it got slow real quickly.

The… lava? went from a possible wave of water to a nice stroll. I mean, the only way you'd be caught in it is if it managed to surround you somehow. And people say lava is dangerous. Clearly they’ve never seen it. So, I continued my flight , going over the lava to see my newest expedition. It was… not a place very conducive to a blood sucking mosquito. It was, for a lack of a better term, a hot barren wasteland. It was honestly probably worse than the wasteland I found past the lake in the first place. There were pools of lava all around. With nothing but ash in between. It would be nice if I could drink lava, but I’m pretty sure I’d burn before even getting close to there. So, I decided to turn around. And… I think the lava sped up when I wasn’t looking. The slow little lava pool that was barely faster than walking distance had covered a huge swath of land behind me.

Love what you're reading? Discover and support the author on the platform they originally published on.

It was everywhere I could see… WAIT A MINUTE! THIS BETTER NOT BE ANOTHER EVIL GRASS PROBLEM! I quickly felt for my connection to my cultists, and they were all there, safe! Alright, it’s just deceptively quick lava. So, where was I? Oh yeah, the way back is gone. I might as well go forward… Despite what anyone else tells you, flying over lava is irritating. It’s so hot that you can feel it all around you. Or maybe that’s just because it’s a fantasy world. Eh, whatever. So, I decided to fly around the pools of lava and continue on my journey.

Overall, it was rather lackluster, until I felt something in the back of my mind. It was a light probing feeling, like something was trying to get in. Yeah I’m out. I think I’d rather not be mind controlled by a random creature that I can’t see. So, I turned around… I turned around. I SAID I TURNED AROUND! I was trying to turn, but my body wasn’t listening to me anymore. I kept going forward, toward a rather large pool of lava, that was rippling. And it was really weird. Have you ever seen water ripple when you drop something in it? It was like that in slow motion. But it was quickly speeding up. Soon, there wasn’t a single piece of stationary lava, and it was moving so fast I couldn’t track a ripple. Then, it started rising. Out of the ground came a… slime? Alright, that is definitely a slime. I got my first view of an actual normal fantasy monster, except it was the size of a trailer, and made of lava. I guess lava slimes aren’t that unusual… WAIT! Not the time for this! I was quickly approaching my death, being brought closer to the giant slime that wanted to envelop me. I was a few meters away, then half, and finally a few centimeters, when I stopped. I couldn’t even see the top of the slime at this point, as I was waaay too close, but I realized something. The probing feeling in my mind had changed. Where before it felt like it was trying to break in, now it was… wrapping around me? And I think amused? What? What the hell did I just come across?
